did.unittitle: Court of Common Pleas, Chester County, PA records

bioghist.p: Records of the Prothonotary, Civil Records of the Sherriff, Select Civil Records of the Circuit Court of Chester County and the Supreme Court of Pennsylvania. This court was based on English practice and was shaped by the laws passed by Pennsylvania’s General Assembly. The court of common pleas heard and determined a variety of civil and equity cases. Primarily, two types of actions concerned the court: personal and real. Personal actions were brought to recover debt or damages or to enforce an obligation imposed on the defendant by his contract. Suits considered personal actions include debt, trespass on case, assumpsit, attachment, and replevin. Real actions were brought for recovery of lands, tenements or hereditaments. Included in this category are dower, partition, estrepement and ejectment actions. Most of the cases before the Chester County Court of Common Pleas were personal actions, specifically debt and trespass.

scopecontent.p: Includes papers, dockets and books. Types of records include but are not limited to: original writs, narratives, affidavits, depositions, interrogatories, petitions of insolvent debtors, naturalizations and divorces, inquisitions, assigned estates, mechanics’ liens and sheriffs’ deeds, Topics: economics, labor, law, immigration, agricultural and industrial development, women, and social and local history. Records are housed at Chester County Archives & Records Services, Govt. Services Center, 601 Westtown Road, West Chester, PA, 19380, 610-344-6760. The Chester County Archives is administered by the Chester County Historical Society in cooperation with the County of Chester.
